body_content.explanation: a line that goes from Alaska in the north to Tierra del Fuego in the south, following the main mountain groups of North and South America, that separates rivers that flow into the Pacific from those that flow into the Atlantic:
examples: The major annual migration route for waterfowl forms a broad, relatively straight line from northeastern Alaska diagonally southward across the prairie marshes of western Canada and the Continental Divide to the Texas coast.
I spent the rest of the summer assisting in his mapping project along the Continental Divide in southwest Montana.
